cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 35 miles WNW of Varadero Cuba and 90 miles south of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then turn north and make landfall along the Florida Panhandle/Alabama coast before curving inland toward the Tennessee Valley and Ohio Valley by mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle or far southeast Alabama coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A â€“ watches confined to Florida Keys and possibly later northern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Florida Keys west of Seven Mile Bridge to Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Florida Panhandle through Alabama, then inland across the Southeast into the Ohio Valley
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds below tropical-storm force possible as the remnant depression passes nearby
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy tropical rainfall of 2-4 inches with localized higher amounts, posing flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: None significant expected at the port aside from rainfall and minor gusty winds
